title: IBM Cloud VPC docs
introduction: With IBM Cloud Virtual Private Cloud (VPC), you can quickly provision virtual server instances and other Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) offerings. Leverage the docs, API & SDK reference, architecture references, and more to support your infrastructure needs.

section_recommended.title: Using the IBM Cloud console to create VPC resources
section_recommended.description: Get up and running quickly by completing this short tutorial to set up a VPC and subnet, configure an ACL, and create a virtual server instance with block storage and networking options.

section_recommended.title: Creating an instance group for auto scaling
section_recommended.description: Set up an instance group to dynamically add or remove instances according to your requirements.

section_recommended.title: About creating an image from a volume
section_recommended.description: Learn about creating a custom image from a boot volume on a virtual server instance.

tiles.title: Sharing images across an enterprise account
tiles.description: You can now share or publish custom images to other accounts within your enterprise by using a private catalog. A private catalog provides a way for you to manage access to products for multiple accounts. You can use any existing x86 virtual server custom image with a private catalog, with the exception of an encrypted image. Custom images can't be deleted while being managed from a catalog and can only be managed from one catalog product offering version at a time. Deleting the catalog does not free its managed resources for a 7-day reclamation period. If you plan to share images with other accounts, users in those accounts should be aware of considerations related to cross-account references to those images.

tiles.title: New stock images for VPC
tiles.description: The Windows Server 2019 Standard Edition with SQL Server 2019 Web Edition bundle and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server are now supported as an operating system stock image when you provision an x86-64 virtual server.

tiles.title: Configuration governance
tiles.description: New VPC config rules for the Image service and Virtual Servers are now available with the Security and Compliance Center.
